## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
1) Get-ChildItem C:\* -Filter P* -Exclude "PerfLogs"

2) Get-ChildItem C:\* -Filter P* -Exclude "PerfLogs" -name

```

## Expected behavior



```
2 should have the same output Items as 1 (trimmed to Names)

```

## Actual behavior

```
2 outputs all Items without "PerfLogs" (-Filter P* is Ignored)

```

This only happens if the -Path has a asteriks, for example

1) Get-ChildItem C:\ -Filter P*
2) Get-ChildItem C:\ -Filter P* -name

has the same output items but now you can`t use "-Include" Or "-Exclude" because:
"When using the -Include parameter, if you don't include an asterisk in the path
 the command returns no output."

title: Get-ChildItem "Name"-Parameter ignores Filter if Path has a asterisk
